metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8760 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ejabberd before 2.1.13 does not enforce the starttls_required setting when compression is used, which causes clients to establish connections without encryption.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8760` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ejabberd - 14.07-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ejabberd package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '14.07-3').
